definition: abbr. for 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1]

sentences.english: In fact, do you even know what the word "cursive" means?
sentences.chinese: 或者應該問，你知道“草書”這個詞是啥意思不？

sentences.english: Chinese cursive writing is very difficult to read.
It looked like the perfect cursive script from the credits of I Love Lucy.
sentences.chinese: 草書的筆跡像是《我愛露西》演員親筆所寫。

sentences.english: I can't remember how to write a capital Z in cursive.
sentences.chinese: 我已經不記得如何用草書去寫大寫的‘Z’了。

sentences.english: When was the last time you wrote cursive?
sentences.chinese: 你上一次寫草書是什麼時候？

sentences.english: Concerning the systemization of cursive hand signs, The contributions of Sunguoting and Yuyouren couldn't be forgotten.
sentences.chinese: 草書符號的系統化，孫過庭與於佑任功不可沒。

sentences.english: Learn how to make cursive letters in this free airbrushing video clip about beginning to airbrush.
sentences.chinese: 瞭解如何在此免費視頻剪輯約祛除噴槍草書字母開始。

sentences.english: Regular and semi- cursive script is mainly used for writing.
sentences.chinese: 正楷和半草書則主要是用來書寫。

sentences.english: Script faces are designed to mimic cursive handwriting or are made from actual handwriting.
sentences.chinese: 腳本面臨的目的是模仿草書手寫或使實際的筆跡。

sentences.english: IV. The limitation of monk cursive script makes its influence brevity.
sentences.chinese: 僧人草書的缺陷使得其影響非常短暫。

sentences.english: Cursive is the inspiration for the best carrier.
sentences.chinese: 草書是創作靈感的最佳載體。

sentences.english: For those who are writing very fast they have semi-cursive and cursive script.
sentences.chinese: 寫得快一些的話，還有行書和草書。

sentences.english: Evaluation is very high, particularly for the most cursive.
sentences.chinese: 評價相當高，尤以草書爲最。

sentences.english: One can also search his scribblings by subject.
sentences.chinese: 人們同樣可以按主題搜索他的草書評語。

sentences.english: The first of these in the field of botany were the herbals.
sentences.chinese: 在植物學領域，這些最早的著作是本草書。

sentences.english: Spice up your airbrush art with cursive letters.
sentences.chinese: 香料與草書藝術的信件你噴槍。

definition: Huang Tingjian (1045-1105), Song poet and calligrapher
abbr. for Shijing 詩經|诗经[Shi1 jing1], the Book of Songs
Yan Zhenqing (709-785), a leading calligrapher of the Tang Dynasty

Su Shi (1037-1101), also known as Su Dongpo 蘇東坡|苏东坡[Su1 Dong1 po1] northern Song Dynasty writer and calligrapher/one of the Three Su father and sons 三蘇|三苏[San1 Su1] and one of the Eight Giants of Tang and Song Prose 唐宋八大家[Tang2 Song4 Ba1 Da4 jia1]
Zhang Xu (probably early 8th century), Tang dynasty poet and calligrapher, most famous for his grass script 草書|草书
